item.description:
Please RSVP!

Market Talk by Harlan Rieur


Harlan gives us his live market analysis on market trends. Using StockCharts.com and his own combination of indicators - Bollinger Bands, stochastic RSI, MACD, Williams%, OBV plus his 13/34 moving averages.

Quantifiable Edges Buying Power Index - Rob Hanna

Rob Hanna of QuantifiableEdges.com has developed some new tools that are proving invaluable. Rob will be discussing them in detailfor us. .



*Do you look to overbought and oversold measures to tell you when the market is likely to reverse?
*Have traditional filters like volume, breadth, and momentum been insufficient in recent years to determine whether a move is likely to persist?

Since 2008 it would have been very difficult making money with many traditional overbought/oversold techniques. Buying power has become a more prevalent factor and needs to be considered. Buying power helps determine the ability of a move to persist or reverse strongly. Quantifiable Edges computes a QE Buying Power Index which has been useful in identifying opportunities both short and intermediate-term.



In this talk, Rob will discuss how to compute the QE Buying Power Index. He’ll also explain the concepts behind the index, giving traders the ability to further research these ideas on their own. Lastly, he will share a simple swing trading system that would have produced strong results both long and short over the last 4 years using the QE Buying Power Index.

Our members value discussion highly. We try to pack as much discussion as possible. Expressing ideas and sharing knowledge is paramount to our members.
All levels of expertise are welcome. No question is too simple - as a matter of fact the simplest question often evokes the best discussion!

If you talk stocks with someone then bring them with you!

To join our online discussion go to
http://groups.google....

Food or drinks are not allowed in any MIT meeting room.

Make your own investment decisions! Investment ideas and recommendations made during our meetings and in our online dialogs bear no liability by anyone.

This is a free and open meeting. No membership is required, but please RSVP.
item.name: Boston Investor's GroupTuesday Meetup
